page.title: 04Yattendon Fete
page.content: expensive flats, and the people who buy them don't come from the village and don't really care about the fete, so this year the committee decided to hold it in the square. The last time this sort of thing had been done was when a street party was held to celebrate the Queen's Silver Jubilee in 1977. Most of the work was done by Mr. Appleby who has four children at the school. He asked the Thames Valley Police if they would divert the traffic around the back of the village and they said that they would. Unfortunately on the day it rained very hard indeed.{Everybody}got wet, including the boys from school who were dancing the Morris with the {Kennet Men,}the adult side. But it did'nt seem to matter really, and apart from the rain it was such a success that it will be held in the
